Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'log_error' parameter is not configured correctly, which may result in missing error logs.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'log_error' is set to a specific file in the logging directory (e.g., /var/log/mysql/error.log).
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'log_error';" | grep -q '/var/log/mysql/error.log' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Log files are stored on the system partition, which may cause disk space exhaustion or unauthorized access.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Store log files on a non-system partition (e.g., /mnt/log/mysql/).

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'log_warnings' parameter is not set to '2', which may reduce logging verbosity.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set 'log_warnings' to '2' to increase log verbosity for security events.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'log_warnings';" | grep -q '2' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Audit logging is not enabled, reducing visibility on database activities.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable the MariaDB audit logging plugin for enhanced logging.
Rule.Correction: sed -i '/\[mysqld\]/a plugin_load_add=audit_log.so; audit_log_policy=ALL;' /etc/mysql/my.cnf; systemctl restart mariadb
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'audit_log_policy';" | grep -q 'ALL' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The audit plugin can be unloaded, which may allow attackers to disable logging.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure MariaDB to prevent unloading the audit plugin.
Rule.Correction: sed -i '/\[mysqld\]/a plugin_load_add=audit_log.so; audit_log_plugin=ON' /etc/mysql/my.cnf; systemctl restart mariadb
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'audit_log_plugin';" | grep -q 'ON' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Binary and relay logs are not encrypted, which may expose sensitive data.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable encryption for binary and relay logs.
Rule.Correction: sed -i '/\[mysqld\]/a encrypt_binlog=ON; relay_log_encryption=ON;' /etc/mysql/my.cnf; systemctl restart mariadb
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'encrypt_binlog';" | grep -q 'ON' && echo 0 || echo 1
